text: 'My dear Glaucus!' said Clodius, 'I rejoice to see that your losses have
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: might take you for the winner, and me for the loser.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: I.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Buy my flowers--O buy--I pray!
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: The blind girl comes from afar;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: If the earth be as fair as I hear them say,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: These flowers her children are!
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Do they her beauty keep?
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: They are fresh from her lap, I know;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: For I caught them fast asleep
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: In her arms an hour ago.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: With the air which is her breath--
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Her soft and delicate breath--
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Over them murmuring low!
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: On their lips her sweet kiss lingers yet,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: And their cheeks with her tender tears are wet.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: For she weeps--that gentle mother weeps--
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: (As morn and night her watch she keeps,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: With a yearning heart and a passionate care)
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: To see the young things grow so fair;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: She weeps--for love she weeps;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: And the dews are the tears she weeps
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: From the well of a mother's love!
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: II.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Ye have a world of light,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Where love in the loved rejoices;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: But the blind girl's home is the House of Night,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: And its beings are empty voices.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: As one in the realm below,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: I stand by the streams of woe!
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: I hear the vain shadows glide,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: I feel their soft breath at my side.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: And I thirst the loved forms to see,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: And I stretch my fond arms around,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: And I catch but a shapeless sound,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: For the living are ghosts to me.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Come buy--come buy?--
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: (Hark! how the sweet things sigh
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: For they have a voice like ours),
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: `The breath of the blind girl closes
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: The leaves of the saddening roses--
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: We are tender, we sons of light,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: We shrink from this child of night;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: From the grasp of the blind girl free us--
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: We yearn for the eyes that see us--
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: We are for night too gay,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: In your eyes we behold the day--
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: O buy--O buy the flowers!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I must have yon bunch of violets, sweet Nydia,' said Glaucus, pressing
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: through the crowd, and dropping a handful of small coins into the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: basket; 'your voice is more charming than ever.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: The blind girl started forward as she heard the Athenian's voice; then
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: as suddenly paused, while the blood rushed violently over neck, cheek,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and temples.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'So you are returned!' said she, in a low voice; and then repeated half
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: to herself, 'Glaucus is returned!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Yes, child, I have not been at Pompeii above a few days.  My garden
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: wants your care, as before; you will visit it, I trust, to-morrow.  And
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: mind, no garlands at my house shall be woven by any hands but those of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the pretty Nydia.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Nydia smiled joyously, but did not answer; and Glaucus, placing in his
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: breast the violets he had selected, turned gaily and carelessly from the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: crowd.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'So she is a sort of client of yours, this child?' said Clodius.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ay--does she not sing prettily?  She interests me, the poor slave!
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Besides, she is from the land of the Gods' hill--Olympus frowned upon
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: her cradle--she is of Thessaly.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'The witches' country.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'True: but for my part I find every woman a witch; and at Pompeii, by
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Venus! the very air seems to have taken a love-philtre, so handsome does
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: every face without a beard seem in my eyes.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'And lo! one of the handsomest in Pompeii, old Diomed's daughter, the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: rich Julia!' said Clodius, as a young lady, her face covered by her
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: veil, and attended by two female slaves, approached them, in her way to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the baths.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Fair Julia, we salute thee!' said Clodius.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Julia partly raised her veil, so as with some coquetry to display a bold
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Roman profile, a full dark bright eye, and a cheek over whose natural
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: olive art shed a fairer and softer rose.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'And Glaucus, too, is returned!' said she, glancing meaningly at the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Athenian.  'Has he forgotten,' she added, in a half-whisper, 'his
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: friends of the last year?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Beautiful Julia! even Lethe itself, if it disappear in one part of the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: earth, rises again in another.  Jupiter does not allow us ever to forget
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: for more than a moment: but Venus, more harsh still, vouchsafes not even
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: a moment's oblivion.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Glaucus is never at a loss for fair words.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Who is, when the object of them is so fair?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'We shall see you both at my father's villa soon,' said Julia, turning
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: to Clodius.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'We will mark the day in which we visit you with a white stone,'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: answered the gamester.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Julia dropped her veil, but slowly, so that her last glance rested on
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the Athenian with affected timidity and real boldness; the glance
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: bespoke tenderness and reproach.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: The friends passed on.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Julia is certainly handsome,' said Glaucus.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'And last year you would have made that confession in a warmer tone.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'True; I was dazzled at the first sight, and mistook for a gem that
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which was but an artful imitation.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Nay,' returned Clodius, 'all women are the same at heart.  Happy he who
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: weds a handsome face and a large dower.  What more can he desire?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Glaucus sighed.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: They were now in a street less crowded than the rest, at the end of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which they beheld that broad and most lovely sea, which upon those
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: delicious coasts seems to have renounced its prerogative of terror--so
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: soft are the crisping winds that hover around its bosom, so glowing and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: so various are the hues which it takes from the rosy clouds, so fragrant
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: are the perfumes which the breezes from the land scatter over its
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: depths.  From such a sea might you well believe that Aphrodite rose to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: take the empire of the earth.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'It is still early for the bath,' said the Greek, who was the creature
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: of every poetical impulse; 'let us wander from the crowded city, and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: look upon the sea while the noon yet laughs along its billows.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'With all my heart,' said Clodius; 'and the bay, too, is always the most
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: animated part of the city.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Pompeii was the miniature of the civilization of that age. Within the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: narrow compass of its walls was contained, as it were, a specimen of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: every gift which luxury offered to power.  In its minute but glittering
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: shops, its tiny palaces, its baths, its forum, its theatre, its
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: circus--in the energy yet corruption, in the refinement yet the vice, of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: its people, you beheld a model of the whole empire. It was a toy, a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: plaything, a showbox, in which the gods seemed pleased to keep the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: representation of the great monarchy of earth, and which they afterwards
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: hid from time, to give to the wonder of posterity--the moral of the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: maxim, that under the sun there is nothing new.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: galleys for the pleasures of the rich citizens.  The boats of the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: fishermen glided rapidly to and fro; and afar off you saw the tall masts
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: of the fleet under the command of Pliny.  Upon the shore sat a Sicilian
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: who, with vehement gestures and flexile features, was narrating to a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: group of fishermen and peasants a strange tale of shipwrecked mariners
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and friendly dolphins--just as at this day, in the modern neighborhood,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: you may hear upon the Mole of Naples.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: solitary part of the beach, and the two friends, seated on a small crag
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which rose amidst the smooth pebbles, inhaled the voluptuous and cooling
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: breeze, which dancing over the waters, kept music with its invisible
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: feet. There was, perhaps, something in the scene that invited them to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: silence and reverie.  Clodius, shading his eyes from the burning sky,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: was calculating the gains of the last week; and the Greek, leaning upon
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: his hand, and shrinking not from that sun--his nation's tutelary
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: deity--with whose fluent light of poesy, and joy, and love, his own
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: veins were filled, gazed upon the broad expanse, and envied, perhaps,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: every wind that bent its pinions towards the shores of Greece.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Tell me, Clodius,' said the Greek at last, 'hast thou ever been in
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: love?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Yes, very often.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'He who has loved often,' answered Glaucus, 'has loved never. There is
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: but one Eros, though there are many counterfeits of him.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'The counterfeits are not bad little gods, upon the whole,' answered
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Clodius.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I agree with you,' returned the Greek.  'I adore even the shadow of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Love; but I adore himself yet more.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Art thou, then, soberly and honestly in love?  Hast thou that feeling
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which the poets describe--a feeling that makes us neglect our suppers,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: forswear the theatre, and write elegies?  I should never have thought
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: it.  You dissemble well.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I am not far gone enough for that,' returned Glaucus, smiling, 'or
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: rather I say with Tibullus--
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: He whom love rules, where'er his path may be, Walks safe and sacred.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: In fact, I am not in love; but I could be if there were but occasion to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: see the object.  Eros would light his torch, but the priests have given
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: him no oil.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Shall I guess the object?--Is it not Diomed's daughter?  She adores
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: you, and does not affect to conceal it; and, by Hercules, I say again
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and again, she is both handsome and rich.  She will bind the door-posts
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: of her husband with golden fillets.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'No, I do not desire to sell myself.  Diomed's daughter is handsome, I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: grant: and at one time, had she not been the grandchild of a freedman, I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: might have...  Yet no--she carries all her beauty in her face; her
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: manners are not maiden-like, and her mind knows no culture save that of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: pleasure.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'You are ungrateful.  Tell me, then, who is the fortunate virgin?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'You shall hear, my Clodius.  Several months ago I was sojourning at
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Neapolis, a city utterly to my own heart, for it still retains the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: manners and stamp of its Grecian origin--and it yet merits the name of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Parthenope, from its delicious air and its beautiful shores. One day I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: entered the temple of Minerva, to offer up my prayers, not for myself
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: more than for the city on which Pallas smiles no longer. The temple was
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: empty and deserted. The recollections of Athens crowded fast and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: meltingly upon me: imagining myself still alone in the temple, and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: absorbed in the earnestness of my devotion, my prayer gushed from my
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: sanctity against which I cannot (nor would I) steel conviction.  I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: believe in mine own knowledge, and that has revealed to me--but no
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: matter.  Now to earthlier and more inviting themes.  If I thus fulfilled
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: my object with Apaecides, what was my design for Ione?  Thou knowest
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: already I intend her for my queen--my bride--my heart's Isis.  Never
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: till I saw her knew I all the love of which my nature is capable.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I hear from a thousand lips that she is a second Helen,' said Calenus;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and he smacked his own lips, but whether at the wine or at the notion it
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: is not easy to decide.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Yes, she has a beauty that Greece itself never excelled,' resumed
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Arbaces. 'But that is not all: she has a soul worthy to match with mine.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: She has a genius beyond that of woman--keen--dazzling--bold. Poetry
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: flows spontaneous to her lips: utter but a truth, and, however intricate
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and profound, her mind seizes and commands it.  Her imagination and her
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: reason are not at war with each other; they harmonize and direct her
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: course as the winds and the waves direct some lofty bark.  With this she
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: unites a daring independence of thought; she can stand alone in the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: world; she can be brave as she is gentle; this is the nature I have
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: sought all my life in woman, and never found till now.  Ione must be
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: mine!  In her I have a double passion; I wish to enjoy a beauty of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: spirit as of form.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'She is not yours yet, then?' said the priest.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'No; she loves me--but as a friend--she loves me with her mind only.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: She fancies in me the paltry virtues which I have only the profounder
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: virtue to disdain.  But you must pursue with me her history. The brother
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and sister were young and rich: Ione is proud and ambitious--proud of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: her genius--the magic of her poetry--the charm of her conversation.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: When her brother left me, and entered your temple, in order to be near
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: him she removed also to Pompeii.  She has suffered her talents to be
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: known.  She summons crowds to her feasts; her voice enchants them; her
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: poetry subdues.  She delights in being thought the successor of Erinna.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Or of Sappho?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'But Sappho without love!  I encouraged her in this boldness of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: career--in this indulgence of vanity and of pleasure.  I loved to steep
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: her amidst the dissipations and luxury of this abandoned city.  Mark me,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Calenus!  I desired to enervate her mind!--it has been too pure to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: receive yet the breath which I wish not to pass, but burningly to eat
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: into, the mirror.  I wished her to be surrounded by lovers, hollow,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: vain, and frivolous (lovers that her nature must despise), in order to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: feel the want of love.  Then, in those soft intervals of lassitude
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: that succeed to excitement--I can weave my spells--excite her
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: interest--attract her passions--possess myself of her heart.  For it is
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: not the young, nor the beautiful, nor the gay, that should fascinate
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Ione; her imagination must be won, and the life of Arbaces has been one
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: scene of triumph over the imaginations of his kind.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'And hast thou no fear, then, of thy rivals?  The gallants of Italy are
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: skilled in the art to please.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'None!  Her Greek soul despises the barbarian Romans, and would scorn
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: itself if it admitted a thought of love for one of that upstart race.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'But thou art an Egyptian, not a Greek!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Egypt,' replied Arbaces, 'is the mother of Athens.  Her tutelary
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Minerva is our deity; and her founder, Cecrops, was the fugitive of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Egyptian Sais. This have I already taught to her; and in my blood she
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: venerates the eldest dynasties of earth.  But yet I will own that of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: late some uneasy suspicions have crossed my mind.  She is more silent
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: than she used to be; she loves melancholy and subduing music; she sighs
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: without an outward cause.  This may be the beginning of love--it may be
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the want of love.  In either case it is time for me to begin my
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: operations on her fancies and her heart: in the one case, to divert the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: source of love to me; in the other, in me to awaken it. It is for this
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: that I have sought you.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'And how can I assist you?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I am about to invite her to a feast in my house: I wish to dazzle--to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: bewilder--to inflame her senses.  Our arts--the arts by which Egypt
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: trained her young novitiates--must be employed; and, under veil of the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: mysteries of religion, I will open to her the secrets of love.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ah! now I understand:--one of those voluptuous banquets that, despite
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: our dull vows of mortified coldness, we, the priests of Isis, have
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: shared at thy house.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'No, no!  Thinkest thou her chaste eyes are ripe for such scenes? No;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: but first we must ensnare the brother--an easier task.  Listen to me,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: while I give you my instructions.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: MORE OF THE FLOWER-GIRL.  THE PROGRESS OF LOVE.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: THE sun shone gaily into that beautiful chamber in the house of Glaucus,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which I have before said is now called the 'Room of Leda'.  The morning
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: rays entered through rows of small casements at the higher part of the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: room, and through the door which opened on the garden, that answered to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the inhabitants of the southern cities the same purpose that a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: greenhouse or conservatory does to us.  The size of the garden did not
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: adapt it for exercise, but the various and fragrant plants with which it
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: was filled gave a luxury to that indolence so dear to the dwellers in a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: sunny clime.  And now the odorous, fanned by a gentle wind creeping from
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the adjacent sea, scattered themselves over that chamber, whose walls
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: vied with the richest colors of the most glowing flowers.  Besides the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: gem of the room--the painting of Leda and Tyndarus--in the centre of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: each compartment of the walls were set other pictures of exquisite
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: beauty.  In one you saw Cupid leaning on the knees of Venus; in another
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Ariadne sleeping on the beach, unconscious of the perfidy of Theseus.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Merrily the sunbeams played to and fro on the tessellated floor and the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: brilliant walls--far more happily came the rays of joy to the heart of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the young Glaucus.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I have seen her, then,' said he, as he paced that narrow chamber--'I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: have heard her--nay, I have spoken to her again--I have listened to the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: music of her song, and she sung of glory and of Greece.  I have
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: discovered the long-sought idol of my dreams; and like the Cyprian
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: sculptor, I have breathed life into my own imaginings.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Longer, perhaps, had been the enamoured soliloquy of Glaucus, but at
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: that moment a shadow darkened the threshold of the chamber, and a young
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: female, still half a child in years, broke upon his solitude.  She was
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: dressed simply in a white tunic, which reached from the neck to the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: ankles; under her arm she bore a basket of flowers, and in the other
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: hand she held a bronze water-vase; her features were more formed than
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: exactly became her years, yet they were soft and feminine in their
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: outline, and without being beautiful in themselves, they were almost
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: made so by their beauty of expression; there was something ineffably
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: gentle, and you would say patient, in her aspect.  A look of resigned
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: sorrow, of tranquil endurance, had banished the smile, but not the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: sweetness, from her lips; something timid and cautious in her
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: step--something wandering in her eyes, led you to suspect the affliction
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: themselves there was no visible defect--their melancholy and subdued
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: light was clear, cloudless, and serene. 'They tell me that Glaucus is
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: here,' said she; 'may I come in?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ah, my Nydia,' said the Greek, 'is that you I knew you would not
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: neglect my invitation.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: he has always been kind to the poor blind girl.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Who could be otherwise?' said Glaucus, tenderly, and in the voice of a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: compassionate brother.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Nydia sighed and paused before she resumed, without replying to his
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: remark. 'You have but lately returned?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'This is the sixth sun that hath shone upon me at Pompeii.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'And you are well?  Ah, I need not ask--for who that sees the earth,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which they tell me is so beautiful, can be ill?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I am well.  And you, Nydia--how you have grown!  Next year you will be
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: thinking what answer to make your lovers.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: A second blush passed over the cheek of Nydia, but this time she frowned
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: as she blushed.  'I have brought you some flowers,' said she, without
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: replying to a remark that she seemed to resent; and feeling about the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: room till she found the table that stood by Glaucus, she laid the basket
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: upon it: 'they are poor, but they are fresh-gathered.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'They might come from Flora herself,' said he, kindly; 'and I renew
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: again my vow to the Graces, that I will wear no other garlands while thy
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: hands can weave me such as these.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'And how find you the flowers in your viridarium?--are they thriving?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Wonderfully so--the Lares themselves must have tended them.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ah, now you give me pleasure; for I came, as often as I could steal the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: leisure, to water and tend them in your absence.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'How shall I thank thee, fair Nydia?' said the Greek.  'Glaucus little
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: dreamed that he left one memory so watchful over his favorites at
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Pompeii.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: The hand of the child trembled, and her breast heaved beneath her tunic.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: flowers,' said she, 'to-day and they will miss me; for I have been ill
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: lately, and it is nine days since I visited them.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: stars--above all, thou canst not behold Ione.'

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: but it was strong; it filled all the sources of their life.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Heart--brain--sense--imagination, all were its ministers and priests.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: As you take some obstacle from two objects that have a mutual
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: had lived separate so long.  And it was natural that they should so
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: love.  Young, beautiful, and gifted--of the same birth, and the same
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: soul--there was poetry in their very union.  They imagined the heavens
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: smiled upon their affection.  As the persecuted seek refuge at the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Ione sighed deeply, and lowered her veil over her eyes.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I wish,' said she, after a pause, 'that he had not been so hasty.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Perhaps, like all who expect too much, he is revolted too easily!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'No.  His main interest was in our happiness.  He thought he promoted
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: that of my brother.  We were left orphans.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Like myself,' said Glaucus, with a deep meaning in his voice.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: him. He loves genius.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: more: its evidence is around us--its name is NATURE.  The error of the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: sages has been to direct their researches to the attributes of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: necessity, where all is gloom and blindness. Had they confined their
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: researches to Nature--what of knowledge might we not already have
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: achieved?  Here patience, examination, are never directed in vain.  We
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: see what we explore; our minds ascend a palpable ladder of causes and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: effects. Nature is the great agent of the external universe, and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Necessity imposes upon it the laws by which it acts, and imparts to us
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the powers by which we examine; those powers are curiosity and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: memory--their union is reason, their perfection is wisdom.  Well, then,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: I examine by the help of these powers this inexhaustible Nature.  I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: examine the earth, the air, the ocean, the heaven: I find that all have
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: a mystic sympathy with each other--that the moon sways the tides--that
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the air maintains the earth, and is the medium of the life and sense of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: things--that by the knowledge of the stars we measure the limits of the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: earth--that we portion out the epochs of time--that by their pale light
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: we are guided into the abyss of the past--that in their solemn lore we
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: discern the destinies of the future. And thus, while we know not that
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which Necessity is, we learn, at least, her decrees.  And now, what
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: morality do we glean from this religion?--for religion it is.  I believe
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: in two deities--Nature and Necessity; I worship the last by reverence,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the first by investigation.  What is the morality my religion teaches?
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: This--all things are subject but to general rules; the sun shines for
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the joy of the many--it may bring sorrow to the few; the night sheds
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: sleep on the multitude--but it harbors murder as well as rest; the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: forests adorn the earth--but shelter the serpent and the lion; the ocean
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: supports a thousand barks--but it engulfs the one. It is only thus for
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the general, and not for the universal benefit, that Nature acts, and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Necessity speeds on her awful course.  This is the morality of the dread
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: agents of the world--it is mine, who am their creature.  I would
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: preserve the delusions of priestcraft, for they are serviceable to the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: multitude; I would impart to man the arts I discover, the sciences I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: perfect; I would speed the vast career of civilizing lore: in this I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: serve the mass, I fulfill the general law, I execute the great moral
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: that Nature preaches.  For myself I claim the individual exception; I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: claim it for the wise--satisfied that my individual actions are nothing
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: in the great balance of good and evil; satisfied that the product of my
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: knowledge can give greater blessings to the mass than my desires can
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: operate evil on the few (for the first can extend to remotest regions
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and humanize nations yet unborn), I give to the world wisdom, to myself
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: freedom. I enlighten the lives of others, and I enjoy my own.  Yes; our
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: wisdom is eternal, but our life is short: make the most of it while it
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: lasts. Surrender thy youth to pleasure, and thy senses to delight.  Soon
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: before you contend with Tetraides.' Lydon smiled disdainfully.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Is he a citizen or a slave?' said Clodius.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: firm in its muscles, so beautifully symmetrical in its proportions, that
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: with swords,' returned Tetraides, sharply, and with an envious scowl.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: cestus is the Greek fashion: I know it well.  You should have encouraged
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: flesh for that contest: you are far too thin for it--avoid the cestus.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: be, Lepidus?--even betting, with swords.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: THE RIVAL OF GLAUCUS PRESSES ONWARD IN THE RACE.

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: IONE was one of those brilliant characters which, but once or twice,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: flash across our career.  She united in the highest perfection the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: rarest of earthly gifts--Genius and Beauty.  No one ever possessed
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: superior intellectual qualities without knowing them--the alliteration
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: of modesty and merit is pretty enough, but where merit is great, the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: veil of that modesty you admire never disguises its extent from its
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: possessor.  It is the proud consciousness of certain qualities that it
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: cannot reveal to the everyday world, that gives to genius that shy, and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: reserved, and troubled air, which puzzles and flatters you when you
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: encounter it.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Ione, then, knew her genius; but, with that charming versatility that
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: belongs of right to women, she had the faculty so few of a kindred
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: genius in the less malleable sex can claim--the faculty to bend and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: model her graceful intellect to all whom it encountered. The sparkling
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: fountain threw its waters alike upon the strand, the cavern, and the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: flowers; it refreshed, it smiled, it dazzled everywhere.  That pride,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which is the necessary result of superiority, she wore easily--in her
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: breast it concentred itself in independence.  She pursued thus her own
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: bright and solitary path.  She asked no aged matron to direct and guide
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: her--she walked alone by the torch of her own unflickering purity.  She
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: obeyed no tyrannical and absolute custom.  She moulded custom to her own
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: will, but this so delicately and with so feminine a grace, so perfect an
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: exemption from error, that you could not say she outraged custom but
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: commanded it.  The wealth of her graces was inexhaustible--she
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: beautified the commonest action; a word, a look from her, seemed magic.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Love her, and you entered into a new world, you passed from this trite
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and commonplace earth.  You were in a land in which your eyes saw
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: everything through an enchanted medium.  In her presence you felt as if
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: listening to exquisite music; you were steeped in that sentiment which
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: has so little of earth in it, and which music so well inspires--that
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: intoxication which refines and exalts, which seizes, it is true, the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: senses, but gives them the character of the soul.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: She was peculiarly formed, then, to command and fascinate the less
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: But this day when he visited her there was a strange calmness on his
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: features, a more quiet and self-possessed expression in his sunken eyes,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: than she had marked for years.  This apparent improvement was but
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: momentary--it was a false calm, which the least breeze could ruffle.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'May the gods bless thee, my brother!' said she, embracing him.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'The gods!  Speak not thus vaguely; perchance there is but one God!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'My brother!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'What if the sublime faith of the Nazarene be true?  What if God be a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: monarch--One--Invisible--Alone?  What if these numerous, countless
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: deities, whose altars fill the earth, be but evil demons, seeking to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: wean us from the true creed?  This may be the case, Ione!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: hearts is that very credulity which peoples the universe with gods.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: answer. We may judge by that reply how obstinate and hard the contest
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which Christianity had to endure among the heathens.  The Graceful
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: scepticism of the heathen philosopher, that the gods were inventions of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: heathen were the suggestions of the arch-enemy of mankind.  The innocent
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: citizen--in short, an excellent man, if he had not taken it into his
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: head to be a philosopher.  Brought up in the schools in which Roman
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: plagiarism worshipped the echo of Grecian wisdom, he had imbued himself
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: with those doctrines by which the later Epicureans corrupted the simple
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: maxims of their great master.  He gave himself altogether up to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: pleasure, and imagined there was no sage like a boon companion.  Still,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: however, he had a considerable degree of learning, wit, and good nature;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and the hearty frankness of his very vices seemed like virtue itself
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: beside the utter corruption of Clodius and the prostrate effeminacy of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Lepidus; and therefore Glaucus liked him the best of his companions; and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: he, in turn, appreciating the nobler qualities of the Athenian, loved
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: him almost as much as a cold muraena, or a bowl of the best Falernian.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'This is a vulgar old fellow, this Diomed,' said Sallust: 'but he has
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: some good qualities--in his cellar!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'And some charming ones--in his daughter.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'True, Glaucus: but you are not much moved by them, methinks.  I fancy
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Clodius is desirous to be your successor.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'He is welcome.  At the banquet of Julia's beauty, no guest, be sure, is
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: considered a musca.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'You are severe: but she has, indeed, something of the Corinthian about
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: her--they will be well matched, after all!  What good-natured fellows we
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: are to associate with that gambling good-for-nought.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Pleasure unites strange varieties,' answered Glaucus.  'He amuses
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'And flatters--but then he pays himself well!  He powders his praise
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: with gold-dust.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'You often hint that he plays unfairly--think you so really?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'My dear Glaucus, a Roman noble has his dignity to keep up--dignity is
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: very expensive--Clodius must cheat like a scoundrel, in order to live
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: like a gentleman.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ha ha!--well, of late I have renounced the dice.  Ah! Sallust, when I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: am wedded to Ione, I trust I may yet redeem a youth of follies. We are
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: both born for better things than those in which we sympathize now--born
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: to render our worship in nobler temples than the stye of Epicurus.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Alas!' returned Sallust, in rather a melancholy tone, 'what do we know
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: more than this--life is short--beyond the grave all is dark? There is no
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: wisdom like that which says "enjoy".'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'By Bacchus!  I doubt sometimes if we do enjoy the utmost of which life
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: is capable.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I am a moderate man,' returned Sallust, 'and do not ask "the utmost".
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: We are like malefactors, and intoxicate ourselves with wine and myrrh,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: as we stand on the brink of death; but, if we did not do so, the abyss
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: would look very disagreeable.  I own that I was inclined to be gloomy
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: until I took so heartily to drinking--that is a new life, my Glaucus.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Yes! but it brings us next morning to a new death.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Why, the next morning is unpleasant, I own; but, then, if it were not
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: so, one would never be inclined to read.  I study betimes--because, by
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the gods! I am generally unfit for anything else till noon.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Fie, Scythian!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Pshaw! the fate of Pentheus to him who denies Bacchus.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Well, Sallust, with all your faults, you are the best profligate I ever
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: met: and verily, if I were in danger of life, you are the only man in
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: all Italy who would stretch out a finger to save me.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Perhaps I should not, if it were in the middle of supper.  But, in
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: truth, we Italians are fearfully selfish.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'So are all men who are not free,' said Glaucus, with a sigh. 'Freedom
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: alone makes men sacrifice to each other.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Freedom, then, must be a very fatiguing thing to an Epicurean,'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: answered Sallust.  'But here we are at our host's.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
