title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: visitors.  Another door to the left on entering communicated with a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: small triangular portico, which belonged to the baths; and behind was
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: already described as chiefly appropriated to Julia.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: In the gallery, then, just mentioned, Diomed received his guests.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: The merchant affected greatly the man of letters, and, therefore, he
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: attention to Glaucus.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'You will see, my friend,' said he, with a wave of his hand, 'that I am
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: a little classical here--a little Cecropian--eh?  The hall in which we
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: shall sup is borrowed from the Greeks.  It is an OEcus Cyzicene.  Noble
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Sallust, they have not, I am told, this sort of apartment in Rome.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: that is most eligible in Greece and in Rome; may you, Diomed, combine
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: the viands as well as the architecture!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'You shall see--you shall see, my Sallust,' replied the merchant.  'We
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: have a taste at Pompeii, and we have also money.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'They are two excellent things,' replied Sallust.  'But, behold, the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: lady Julia!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: The main difference, as I have before remarked, in the manner of life
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: observed among the Athenians and Romans, was, that with the first, the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: latter, they were the common ornaments of the banquet; but when they
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: were present at the feast, it usually terminated at an early hour.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: gold, the handsome Julia entered the apartment.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and his wife, Lepidus, Clodius, and the Roman senator, entered almost
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: of the guests.  Ione yet tarried.

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Trifles! trifles!' reiterated the merchant.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Meanwhile, Glaucus found himself by one of the windows of the gallery,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which communicated with the terraces, and the fair Julia by his side.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Is it an Athenian virtue, Glaucus,' said the merchant's daughter, 'to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: shun those whom we once sought?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Fair Julia--no!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Yet methinks, it is one of the qualities of Glaucus.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Glaucus never shuns a friend!' replied the Greek, with some emphasis on
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the last word.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'May Julia rank among the number of his friends?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'It would be an honour to the emperor to find a friend in one so
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: lovely.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'You evade my question,' returned the enamoured Julia.  'But tell me, is
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: it true that you admire the Neapolitan Ione?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Does not beauty constrain our admiration?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ah! subtle Greek, still do you fly the meaning of my words.  But say,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: shall Julia be indeed your friend?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'If she will so favor me, blessed be the gods!  The day in which I am
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: goes--you move away involuntarily--you are impatient to join Ione!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: For at that moment Ione had entered, and Glaucus had indeed betrayed the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: emotion noticed by the jealous beauty.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Can admiration to one woman make me unworthy the friendship of another?
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Sanction not so, O Julia the libels of the poets on your sex!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Well, you are right--or I will learn to think so.  Glaucus, yet one
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'If the Fates permit, such is my blessed hope.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Accept, then, from me, in token of our new friendship, a present for
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: ever assimilate to the qualities of our own nature.  The hero weeps less
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: them.  All of us are human, and Arbaces, criminal as he was, had his
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: share of our common feelings and our mother clay. Had he but obtained
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: strained every nerve to save his rival.  Even now his hatred was
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: NYDIA AFFECTS THE SORCERESS.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: WHEN the Thessalian found that Arbaces returned to her no more--when she
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: was left, hour after hour, to all the torture of that miserable suspense
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which was rendered by blindness doubly intolerable, she began, with
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: outstretched arms, to feel around her prison for some channel of escape;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and finding the only entrance secure, she called aloud, and with the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: vehemence of a temper naturally violent, and now sharpened by impatient
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: agony.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ho, girl!' said the slave in attendance, opening the door; art thou bit
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: by a scorpion? or thinkest thou that we are dying of silence here, and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: only to be preserved, like the infant Jupiter, by a hullabaloo?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Where is thy master? and wherefore am I caged here?  I want air and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: liberty: let me go forth!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Alas! little one, hast thou not seen enough of Arbaces to know that his
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: will is imperial!  He hath ordered thee to be caged; and caged thou art,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: and I am thy keeper.  Thou canst not have air and liberty; but thou
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: mayst have what are much better things--food and wine.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Proh Jupiter!' cried the girl, wringing her hands; 'and why am I thus
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: imprisoned?  What can the great Arbaces want with so poor a thing as I
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: am?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'That I know not, unless it be to attend on thy new mistress, who has
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: been brought hither this day.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'What! Ione here?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Yes, poor lady; she liked it little, I fear.  Yet, by the Temple of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Castor! Arbaces is a gallant man to the women.  Thy lady is his ward,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: thou knowest.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Wilt thou take me to her?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'She is ill--frantic with rage and spite.  Besides, I have no orders to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: do so; and I never think for myself.  When Arbaces made me slave of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: these chambers, he said, "I have but one lesson to give thee--while thou
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: servest me, thou must have neither ears, eyes, nor thought; thou must be
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: but one quality--obedience."'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'But what harm is there in seeing Ione?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'That I know not; but if thou wantest a companion, I am willing to talk
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: to thee, little one, for I am solitary enough in my dull cubiculum.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: And, by the way, thou art Thessalian--knowest thou not some cunning
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: amusement of knife and shears, some pretty trick of telling fortunes, as
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: most of thy race do, in order to pass the time.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Tush, slave, hold thy peace! or, if thou wilt speak, what hast thou
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: heard of the state of Glaucus?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Why, my master has gone to the Athenian's trial; Glaucus will smart for
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: it!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'For what?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'The murder of the priest Apaecides.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ha!' said Nydia, pressing her hands to her forehead; 'something of this
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: I have indeed heard, but understand not.  Yet, who will dare to touch a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: hair of his head?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'That will the lion, I fear.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Averting gods! what wickedness dost thou utter?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Why, only that, if he be found guilty, the lion, or may be the tiger,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: will be his executioner.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Nydia leaped up, as if an arrow had entered her heart; she uttered a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: piercing scream; then, falling before the feet of the slave, she cried,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: in a tone that melted even his rude heart:
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ah! tell me thou jestest--thou utterest not the truth--speak, speak!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Why, by my faith, blind girl, I know nothing of the law; it may not be
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: so bad as I say.  But Arbaces is his accuser, and the people desire a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: victim for the arena.  Cheer thee! But what hath the fate of the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Athenian to do with thine?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'No matter, no matter--he has been kind to me: thou knowest not, then,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: what they will do?  Arbaces his accuser!  O fate!  The people--the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: people!  Ah! they can look upon his face--who will be cruel to the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Athenian!--Yet was not Love itself cruel to him?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: So saying, her head drooped upon her bosom: she sunk into silence;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: scalding tears flowed down her cheeks; and all the kindly efforts of the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: slave were unable either to console her or distract the absorption of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: her reverie.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: When his household cares obliged the ministrant to leave her room, Nydia
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: began to re-collect her thoughts.  Arbaces was the accuser of Glaucus;
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Arbaces had imprisoned her here; was not that a proof that her liberty
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: might be serviceable to Glaucus?  Yes, she was evidently inveigled into
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: some snare; she was contributing to the destruction of her beloved!  Oh,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: how she panted for release!  Fortunately, for her sufferings, all sense
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: of pain became merged in the desire of escape; and as she began to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: revolve the possibility of deliverance, she grew calm and thoughtful.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: She possessed much of the craft of her sex, and it had been increased in
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: her breast by her early servitude.  What slave was ever destitute of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: cunning?  She resolved to practise upon her keeper; and calling suddenly
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: to mind his superstitious query as to her Thessalian art, she hoped by
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: that handle to work out some method of release.  These doubts occupied
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: her mind during the rest of the day and the long hours of night; and,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: accordingly, when Sosia visited her the following morning, she hastened
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: to divert his garrulity into that channel in which it had before evinced
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: a natural disposition to flow.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: She was aware, however, that her only chance of escape was at night; and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: accordingly she was obliged with a bitter pang at the delay to defer
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: till then her purposed attempt.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'The night,' said she, 'is the sole time in which we can well decipher
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the decrees of Fate--then it is thou must seek me.  But what desirest
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: thou to learn?'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'By Pollux! I should like to know as much as my master; but that is not
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: to be expected.  Let me know, at least, whether I shall save enough to
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: purchase my freedom, or whether this Egyptian will give it me for
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: nothing.  He does such generous things sometimes.  Next, supposing that
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: be true, shall I possess myself of that snug taberna among the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Myropolia, which I have long had in my eye?  'Tis a genteel trade that
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: of a perfumer, and suits a retired slave who has something of a
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: gentleman about him!'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Ay! so you would have precise answers to those questions?--there are
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: various ways of satisfying you.  There is the Lithomanteia, or
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Speaking-stone, which answers your prayer with an infant's voice; but,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: then, we have not that precious stone with us--costly is it and rare.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Then there is the Gastromanteia, whereby the demon casts pale and deadly
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: images upon the water, prophetic of the future.  But this art requires
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: also glasses of a peculiar fashion, to contain the consecrated liquid,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: which we have not.  I think, therefore, that the simplest method of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: satisfying your desire would be by the Magic of Air.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'I trust,' said Sosia, tremulously, 'that there is nothing very
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: frightful in the operation?  I have no love for apparitions.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Fear not; thou wilt see nothing; thou wilt only hear by the bubbling of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: water whether or not thy suit prospers.  First, then, be sure, from the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: rising of the evening star, that thou leavest the garden-gate somewhat
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: open, so that the demon may feel himself invited to enter therein; and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: place fruits and water near the gate as a sign of hospitality; then,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: my mother taught me. But forget not the garden-gate--all rests upon
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: that: it must be open when you come, and for three hours previously.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: 'Trust me,' replied the unsuspecting Sosia; 'I know what a gentleman's
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: feelings are when a door is shut in his face, as the cookshop's hath

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

text: pretty one, here is thy morning's meal.'
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: While thus conversing, the first formalities of the show were over.  To
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: these succeeded a feigned combat with wooden swords between the various
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: now arranged in pairs, as agreed beforehand; their weapons examined; and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: only by an exciting and preliminary blast of warlike music.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: It was often customary to begin the sports by the most cruel of all, and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: some bestiarius, or gladiator appointed to the beasts, was slain first,
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: as an initiatory sacrifice.  But in the present instance, the
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: experienced Pansa thought it better that the sanguinary drama should
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: advance, not decrease, in interest and, accordingly, the execution of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: Olinthus and Glaucus was reserved for the last.  It was arranged that
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: bloody spectacle; and the tiger and the Nazarene be the grand finale.
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: And, in the spectacles of Pompeii, the reader of Roman history must
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: limit his imagination, nor expect to find those vast and wholesale
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: exhibitions of magnificent slaughter with which a Nero or a Caligula
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: regaled the inhabitants of the Imperial City.  The Roman shows, which
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: absorbed the more celebrated gladiators, and the chief proportion of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: foreign beasts, were indeed the very reason why, in the lesser towns of
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

text: the empire, the sports of the amphitheatre were comparatively humane and
title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
author: Lytton, Edward Bulwer Lytton, Baron

title: The Last Days of Pompeii

title: The Last Days of Pompeii
